reference.title: SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR system procedure
reference.shortdesc: The SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR system procedure replaces a jar file in a database.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672))

dlentry.dd: The path or URL of the jar file to use as a replacement. A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional). For example: d:/todays_build/tours.jar
The name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name. Two examples: MYSCHEMA.Sample1 -- a delimited identifier. MYSCHEMA."Sample2"

section.title: Execute privileges
section.p: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the database owner has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

section.title: SQL example
section.codeblock:
-- SQL statement CALL sqlj.replace_jar('c:\myjarfiles\newtours.jar', 'APP.Sample1')
-- SQL statement -- replace jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2')
